definitions.definition: used instead of something in negative sentences and in questions; after if/whether; and after verbs such as prevent, ban, avoid, etc.

examples.text: There's never anything worth watching on TV.
If you remember anything at all, please let us know.
We hope to prevent anything unpleasant from happening.

definitions.definition: any thing at all, when it does not matter which

examples.text: I'm so hungry, I'll eat anything.
Is there anything *(= any truth)* in these rumours?
The hotel was anything but cheap.
He isn't anything like my first boss.
I felt as pleased as anything.
They're always slagging me off like anything.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that something is not as good, not enough, etc.

examples.text: The book wasn't anything like as good as her first one.
I wouldn't give it up for anything.

definitions.definition: or another thing of a similar type

examples.text: If you want to call a meeting or anything, just let me know.
